job.title: Associate Research Scientist (Flow Cytometry / Cell Culture)
job.description: <p><strong>100% onsite</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities include but are not limited to:</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Independently execute in vitro assays to evaluate the efficacy and specificity of immune cell-engaging biotherapeutics. Including NK and T cell assays from human PBMC using cytokine and flow cytometry readouts amongst others.</li><li>Apply knowledge of immune cell function and relevant technical skills to develop novel assay systems and provide biology support for development of next-generation immune cell engagers – including use of both cellular and molecular skills</li><li>Collaborate effectively across multiple projects and groups in a matrixed environment to develop positive relationships and help drive synergistic outcomes.</li><li>Anticipate the need for contingencies and demonstrate flexibility through development of alternative strategies to achieve outcomes.</li><li>Present project updates to project teams, managers and working groups.</li><li>Provide written reports to support regulatory documents and invention disclosures.</li><li>Provide and assist training of colleagues on lab techniques and equipment.</li><li>Maintain knowledge of relevant assays and science through the literature and other sources.</li><li>Assist in routine maintenance of laboratory equipment and resources.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>M.S. in immunology, immuno-oncology, or a related field with minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience or B.S. with minimum of 4 years of relevant work experience in relevant fields. Industry experience preferred.</li><li>Experience with immune and oncology related cell types including subset of T cells, NK cells, transformed tumor cells. Basic knowledge of T/NK cell biology and hands-on experience is strongly preferred.</li><li>Experience with technologies typically employed to assess immune cell function including but not limited to subset of multi-color flow cytometry, Luminex, MSD, IncuCyte-based assays, T/NK cell activation assays, ADCC assays, T/NK cell proliferation assays, 3-D cell cultures, imaging technologies.</li><li>Experience in genetic transduction and characterization of cells in vitro preferred.</li><li>Self-motivated and able to work on multiple projects in a matrix environment.</li><li>Ability to work well as both team member and as individual contributor is essential.</li><li>Excellent oral communication skills for cross-functional interactions.</li><li>Requires strong organizational skills to ensure thorough and timely documentation of experiments, and preparation of data for compiling reports.</li><li>Experience with antibody drug discovery is an advantage.</li></ul><li></li>
